abstracts.cdata!:
The China Smallholder Cattle Development
            Project has a satisfactory outcome, is highly likely to be
            sustainable, and has a substantial institutional development
            impact. Bank performance was satisfactory and borrower
            performance is highly satisfactory. A number of key lessons,
            both positive and negative, were learned during project
            implementation: 1) In a rapidly changing business and
            lending climate, slowness in loan processing could make IBRD
            loans: (a) less competitive in a fast evolving domestic
            lending market; and (b) less attractive to effective
            end-users who strive for efficiency. 2) Greater flexibility
            in project design and implementation is essential to
            successful commercial operations. Under the project: (a) the
            Special Accounts, intended to provide fund liquidity, were
            not wholly made use of; (b) some Bank procedures such as
            cattle procurement arrangements for smallholders were
            unworkable; and (c) the rigid prescriptions in project
            design of smallholder production models were not responsive
            to rapidly changing market conditions and farmer demands.
            However, the Bank showed great flexibility when it adopted
            more appropriate cattle procurement procedures and updated
            production models. 3) The government's strong
            commitment to reforms and continuous support to the
            integrated cattle breeding, production, processing and
            marketing system have been the foundation of the project
            design and the primary force for project implementation as
            well as the close cooperation between government agencies at
            various levels. 4) An effective project management
            structure, committed project staff, and strong emphasis on
            monitoring and evaluation contributed significantly to
            successful project preparation and implementation.

439506.trustfund:
TF029621-PHRD-ANIMAL HUSBANDRY PROJ.(BANK-EXEC.),TF035793-CHINA - SMALLHOLDER CATTLE
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF029720-PHRD-ANIMAL HUSBANDRY DEV.PROJ.(RECIPIENT-EXEC.)

repnme.cdata!:
China - Smallholder Cattle Development
            Project - environmental assessment summary

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment of
            the Smallholder Cattle Development Project which promotes
            cattle production, marketing, beef processing and support
            service systems in China. This report describes the measures
            planned to mitigate negative environmental impacts
            associated with this project. Every dust outlet will have a
            dust absorption cover and pipeline system connected to a
            dust collector. Installing silencers and noise-proof
            facilities will reduce noise and establishing regulations
            will direct the use of protective equipment. In workshop
            areas and wherever there is a high concentration of ambient
            dust, dust monitoring and alarm systems will be installed.
            Fire hazard and control measures include hydrants, fire
            extinguishers, and pressure equalization openings.
            Feedlot-discharged wastewater coming from cattle urine, shed
            washing, cattle cooling, and worker living will be mitigated
            by daily watering and site cleaning. There will be regular
            monitoring of groundwater quality and odors, and structures
            intended to treat sewage, like sedimentation ponds and berm
            dikes will be installed along with a manure disposal plan.
            Cattle waste and feed residual can be mixed and piled and
            used as organic fertilizer. Trees will be planted around the
            feedlot and the market. Environmental training will be
            provided to farmers and administrative staff. A resettlement
            plan will compensate project affected persons.

888052.trustfund:
TF029621-PHRD-ANIMAL HUSBANDRY PROJ.(BANK-EXEC.),TF035793-CHINA - SMALLHOLDER CATTLE
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF029720-PHRD-ANIMAL HUSBANDRY DEV.PROJ.(RECIPIENT-EXEC.)

abstracts.cdata!:
The Small-holder Cattle Development
            Project aims at improving cattle productivity, through an
            increased efficiency of converted low-value crop residues,
            into high-value beef, and beef products. It will further
            promote marketing linkages on cattle profitability,
            integrating markets, producers, and processors into a
            demand-oriented marketing system. The project components
            will: 1) improve cattle breed, suitable for commercial
            production, while preserving indigenous breeds. It will
            strengthen the efforts of provincial governments in cattle
            breed improvement, upgrading beef bull stations, and where
            necessary, will import bulls for cross-breeding. Artificial
            insemination will be complemented with new frozen-straw
            technology, to improve the genetic system. Cattle
            vitamin-mineral molasses blocks will be produced, through a
            pilot plant; 2) increase cattle production, as a result of
            the cattle breed and feed improvements, and, adequate
            veterinary services, and animal husbandry practices. With
            forage enhancement technologies available, sub-components
            will include household cow-calf raising and cattle
            fattening, and small-scale commercial feedlots; 3) support
            cattle and beef market development, as well as upgrade
            slaughtering/processing facilities, for quality assurance
            participation; 4) assist the government, by strengthening
            institutional capacity for better international
            compatibility practices.

439451.trustfund:
TF029621-PHRD-ANIMAL HUSBANDRY PROJ.(BANK-EXEC.),TF035793-CHINA - SMALLHOLDER CATTLE
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF029720-PHRD-ANIMAL HUSBANDRY DEV.PROJ.(RECIPIENT-EXEC.)

repnme.cdata!:
China - Smallholder Cattle Development
            Project : resettlement action plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The Smallholder Cattle Development
            Project aims to promote cattle production, marketing, beef
            processing and support service systems in Hebei, Henan,
            Shanxi, and Anhui. For each province, this resettlement
            report includes a resettlement issues matrix, a listing of
            all project sites and uses, and detailed compensation
            budgets. The project is designed to maximize the use of land
            and facilities already in use for cattle production, rather
            than acquiring new sites or facilities. Since beef cattle
            raising does not require expensive arable land, most of the
            land sites have been specifically selected on non-inhabited,
            non-cultivated waste lands or on land already owned by the
            sponsoring production units. No persons are scheduled for
            resettlement. Compensation applies only to compensation for
            newly acquired land to be occupied for project activities.
            All other land to be used for project activities is already
            owned by the project sponsors and does not require
            compensation. In case that resettlement is necessary, this
            report covers the resettlement principles and policy to be
            followed. A land acquisition monitoring structure will be
            set up as part of the overall project management infrastructure.

docna.cdata!:
China - Smallholder Cattle Development
            Project : resettlement action plan

            Development Project : resettlement action plan

439726.trustfund:
TF029621-PHRD-ANIMAL HUSBANDRY PROJ.(BANK-EXEC.),TF035793-CHINA - SMALLHOLDER CATTLE
            DEVELOPMENT PROJECT,TF029720-PHRD-ANIMAL HUSBANDRY DEV.PROJ.(RECIPIENT-EXEC.)

repnme.cdata!:
China - Smallholder Cattle Development
            Project - environmental assessment summary

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment of
            the Smallholder Cattle Development Project which promotes
            cattle production, marketing, beef processing and support
            service systems in China. This report describes the measures
            planned to mitigate negative environmental impacts
            associated with this project. Every dust outlet will have a
            dust absorption cover and pipeline system connected to a
            dust collector. Installing silencers and noise-proof
            facilities will reduce noise and establishing regulations
            will direct the use of protective equipment. In workshop
            areas and wherever there is a high concentration of ambient
            dust, dust monitoring and alarm systems will be installed.
            Fire hazard and control measures include hydrants, fire
            extinguishers, and pressure equalization openings.
            Feedlot-discharged wastewater coming from cattle urine, shed
            washing, cattle cooling, and worker living will be mitigated
            by daily watering and site cleaning. There will be regular
            monitoring of groundwater quality and odors, and structures
            intended to treat sewage, like sedimentation ponds and berm
            dikes will be installed along with a manure disposal plan.
            Cattle waste and feed residual can be mixed and piled and
            used as organic fertilizer. Trees will be planted around the
            feedlot and the market. Environmental training will be
            provided to farmers and administrative staff. A resettlement
            plan will compensate project affected persons.

China - Smallholder Cattle Development
            Project - environmental assessment summary

            Development Project - environmental assessment summary
